itec.minicompiler.SymbolTable
Class AddressedSymbol

java.lang.Object
  itec.minicompiler.SymbolTable.Symbol
      itec.minicompiler.SymbolTable.TypedSymbol
          itec.minicompiler.SymbolTable.AddressedSymbol
public class AddressedSymbol
extends TypedSymbol

The AddressedSymbol implements a Symbol in the SymbolTable which has also an address in addition to the TypedSymbol-attributes.

An AddressedSymbol can be of one of four types:

  • PROCEDURE (A predefined or userdefined procedure)
  • PARAMETER_IN (An input-parameter for a procedure)
  • PARAMETER_IN_OUT (An input/output-parameter for a procedure)
  • VARIABLE (A simple global or local variable)

    • Version:
    1.0 (29.09.2004)
    Author:
    Stefan Leitner, Stefan Schauer

    clone

    public java.lang.Object clone()
    Return a clone of the actual AddressedSymbol. The cloning is restricted on the actual AddressedSymbol, what means that the pointers of the new AddressedSymbol have the same targets as the pointers of the actual AddressedSymbol (a shallow-clone is implemented).

    Overrides:
    clone in class TypedSymbol
    Returns:
    An Object equal to the actual AddressedSymbol
    See Also:
    Object.clone()
